item.title: Caesar's civil war
item.description:
730af to 750AF
Following the order of a jealous Senate to strip the conquer of his due reward. Caesar led his legions across the Rubicon.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caesar%27s_civil_war
The assassination that never was.
Caesar listened to his wife's warning to not attend the senate on the ides of march. He send his friend Marc Anthony to end the senate session. The conspirators went to his house. They were greeted by his wife at the door who refused them entry. Lucius Tillius Cimber drew his dagger and stabbed her. Her screams allowed Caesar to bar himself upstairs. While nearby plebs who had witness the murder called for mob to protect him.
The conspirators were dragged from the house before they get to Caesar and thrown from Tarpeian Rock. Their families were stripped of their wealth and exiled from the city forever.
Sick of all the death, Caesar left Rome to Egypt to join Cleopatra and his son.
He left all his roman estates to his nephew Octavian.
Together they started Caesar dynasty and formed allowed Egypt to be an independent vassal of Rome.

item.title: civil war
item.description:
from 690AF TO 710AF
Fought between Sulla and Cinna's supporters.
The first time the republic dictatorship was taken by force
The establishment of the position of the quartermaster general. The beginning of the fame Roman logistics.

item.title: Expansion Period
item.description:
From 200AF to 500AF
The slow taken of Mainland Italy.
Key Points
Divide and conquered all of Italy.
Moved the legions from wealth to experience and age based.
The establishment of the twelve tables

item.title: Foundation of Rome
item.description:
21 April 0AF
Key Events

Remus death
Founding of the Vestal Virgins
Eternal flame
Construction of the Forum
Stone Magic
Enshrinement of Republic
No kings degree
Allying themselves with the Trojan refugees and disgruntled Etruscan warriors to allowed Rome to survive.

item.title: Punic Wars
item.description:
From 520AF to 660AF
the elemental kings of Carthage and their fire touched elites

item.title: The Plebs Republic
item.description:
800AF to 1100AF
The death of so many patricians in Caesars civil war led to power shifting to the plebs.
25 Pleb families were raise to senatorial status.
Expansion of Rome influence to Britain and east Europe
The empire was becoming to big to rule from one central location
Numerous revolts lead to the formation of the vassal republic

item.title: Vassal Republic
item.description:
The formation of a second senate to represent the regions.
Each state is formed in the following manner
3-10 Legions all raised from different states. Upon finish of service, the soldiers would be expected to settle in the new state.
Rule by a small council
A Judge appointed by Rome
4 plebs elected by the citizen
3 Military leaders.
1 Master of rules, who only votes for tie breakers. In the event of war he become dictator for the duration
A communication legion
An engineer legion

item.title: Julian Family
item.description:
Following Caesar's departure, the young Octavian took on the responsibility for his uncle estates around Rome.
He trained each of seven sons to take control of a different aspect of roman life
Politics - Julian ūnus
Military - Julian duo
Engineering - Julian trēs
Academica - Julian quattuor
Banking - Julian quīnque
Shipping - Julian sex
Farming - Julian septem
The Julian are renown for bringing in talent from outside the family and country

item.title: Welcome
item.description:
The year is 1495AF. The Roman republic stands strong having weathered many storms since the Dwarf Romulus and Remus emerged from the Highlands and laid the Foundation of Rome in a single day.
The characters will play members of the extended Julian family.
Upon reaching their majority year all member must perform at least a year in service of the state.
The characters have elected to perform as sheriffs in the wine region of Latina
Julian Family
History breakdown
